alert.note: Alert for Madison; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:44AM CST until January 25 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Madison Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Northeastern Tensas Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Hinds County in central Mississippi... Madison County in central Mississippi... Rankin County in central Mississippi... Northern Claiborne County in southwestern Mississippi... South Central Issaquena County in west central Mississippi... Warren County in west central Mississippi... * Until 245 PM CST Thursday. * At 844 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over the last 24 hours. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 3 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jackson, Clinton, Pearl, Madison, Ridgeland, Vicksburg, Brandon, Canton, Byram, Flowood, Richland, Florence, Gluckstadt, Raymond, Flora, Pelahatchie, Terry, Edwards, Utica and Bolton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 3 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
